# üïµÔ∏è SpyID ‚Äî Find Telegram User IDs by @username

**SpyID** is a simple Python script that allows you to retrieve the Telegram User ID of any public account by entering their `@username` ‚Äî directly from the command line.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è You must log in with your own Telegram account via the [Telegram API](https://my.telegram.org) to use this tool. It does not work for private users or usernames that don‚Äôt exist.

---

![Screenshot]([https://exemplo.com/imagem.jpg](https://media.discordapp..png?ex=67fcf5c9&is=67fba449&hm=f9b379c16adc751b6224b56d0ddf2aacbc02a71891f8bdd40bf1b4862d67ca32&=&format=webp&quality=lossless&width=1044&height=349))

## üöÄ Features

- Retrieve Telegram user IDs via `@username`
- Accepts input with or without `@`
- Command-line interface (CMD/Terminal)
- Keeps the window open after execution
- Fully local ‚Äî no bot required

---

## üß© Requirements

- Python 3.7 or higher
- A Telegram account
- API credentials (`api_id` and `api_hash`)

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Installation

1. Clone the repository:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/spyid.git
cd spyid
